intro: Anechites nerium, commonly known as the common spurge, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers clustered in spherical inflorescences, which appear in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy coating, while its stems are covered in fine, white hairs. Anechites nerium is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in waste areas.
